metadata.title: CVE-2019-13737 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in autocomplete in Google Chrome prior to79.0.3945.79 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitiveinformation from process memory via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
